data.event: The population was 27,552 in the 2010 census, compared to 26,009 in 2000.
In April 1851, Anson found what he described as “the prettiest place in Iowa.”
In 1853 Anson named the town Marshall, after Marshall, Michigan, a former residence of his.
The town became Marshalltown in 1862 because another Marshall already existed in Henry County, Iowa (In 1880, Marshall's name changed to Wayland).
The town became Marshalltown in 1862 because another Marshall already existed in Henry County, Iowa (In 1880, Marshall's name changed to Wayland).

event.title: 1863 the title of county seat transferred

data.event: In 1863 the title of county seat transferred from the village of Marietta to Marshalltown.
